item.title: Recently resurfaced patch appears to be breaking down, 7th October
item.description:
Recently resurfaced patch appears to be breaking down, starting to create a pothole. It's under the pedestrian bridge, left lane, eastbound, towards the C&G roundabout. I see a note says the area may be due for resurfacing, but could it be surveyed please, and if not due for re-surfacing, be repaired ? So much traffic going through will disintegrate it quickly. Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: PROW ASM15 is obstructed by a high palisade steel gate, 7th October
item.description:
The erection of these gates obstructing ASM15 was first reported in November 2020. It is now nearly four years since PROW were informed and it really is about time something was done! I am reporting again because I see the obstruction is not even registered as an outstanding issue on the County Council map.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement from Coombe Hill to The Leigh, 7th October
item.description:
The path from Coombe Hill to The Leigh is unusable in places due to poor surface, uneven tarmac, holes in the path. Overgrown vegetation on both sides of path and verge. Path from Pancake Lane/Corner to the village has disappeared completely due to years of neglect. This has been ongoing for years and nothing has been done. Vegetation forces you onto the road in places, doing this in the dusk/dark is dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement needing repair, 7th October
item.description:
All across the frontage of 169 Hewlett Road the pavement is uneven and damaged. It looks like a utility company has badly backfilled an hole and itâ€™s dropped. Also there are 3 incorrectly placed raised kerb stones which need to be lowered. One section has already been reported and marked however the whole of this section is dangerous to the public. It also is permanently water logged during Winter. Any help is appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Hewlett Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Drain is blocked by tree roots, 7th October
item.description:
The drain outside 349 Hatherley Road is blocked by cedar tree roots. The cedar tree which was owned by Gloucestershire Highways has now been removed but the drain is not flowing properly. My insurance company has commissioned a drainage report which says that part of drain that is full of roots is the councils responsibility to clear and repair. Unfortunately the blockage is causing problems with sewage backing up in the pipes and is causing offensive smells and the toilet to back up. We have tried rodding the roots numerous times but this has not been effective. The drains on my property are damaged and need repair and therefore I understand that drains on council land are also likely to need to be cleared and repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 349, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 7th October
item.description:

item.title: There is still a pothole at the scene you claim to have repaired, 7th October
item.description:
There are 2 former trench lines that require attention. Your contractors have shoved some tar into one but failed to take it to the full width of the road. Do you check your contractors' workmanship?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alderton Road, Gretton, Tewkesbury

item.title: Recently filled potholes sunk on B4063, 7th October
Pothole, 7th October
Large stones placed along roadside verge, 7th October
item.description:
A large number of rocks and stones have been placed along the edge of the grass verge, within inches of the tarmac road edge. There is no pedestrian pathway along this road. The stones constitute an obstruction and a significant risk to all road users and in particular, pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colesbourne, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
